articles.title: How Jewish politics are shaping the 2026 election map, from coast to coast
articles.description: (JTA) — After a year in which Israel, antisemitism and political polarization scrambled long-standing alliances, the American Jewish political map is heading into 2026 unusually unsettled. From New York City Hall to swing-state governors’ mansions to some of the most crowded Democratic primaries in memory, the coming election cycle will test how much Jewish voters... The post How Jewish politics are shaping the 2026 election map, from coast to coast appeared first on The Forward .

articles.title: Somaliland already operates as a de facto state. So why is Israel’s recognition of it so controversial?
articles.description: Last week, Israel became the first nation in the world to recognize Somaliland as a country, prompting global outcry and an emergency meeting of the United Nations. The de facto state on the northern coast of the Horn of Africa has long operated independent of Somalia, but before Israel’s announcement, its sovereignty had not been... The post Somaliland already operates as a de facto state. So why is Israel’s recognition of it so controversial? appeared first on The Forward .

articles.title: Julius Berman, Orthodox rabbi whose influence spanned secular and observant Jewish institutions, dies at 90
articles.description: Rabbi Julius Berman, who led the Orthodox Union and a myriad of other prominent Jewish communal organizations across the Orthodox and secular Jewish world, has died at 90. Born in Lithuania in 1935 to Rabbi Henoch and Sarah Berman, Berman immigrated with his family to Hartford, Connecticut, in 1940 where he was among the first... articles.title: A legendary graphic novelist gets the (bio)graphic novel treatment
articles.description: In 1992, Art Spiegelman’s Maus won the Pulitzer prize. The first graphic novel to win the award, Maus testified both to Spiegelman’s singular brilliance and to the graphic novel’s acceptance as a serious medium. This owed a great deal to one man: Will Eisner. A legendary figure within the comic book and graphic novel industries,... articles.title: Before ‘SNL,’ there was Sid Caesar — and a roomful of Jewish writers
articles.description: (JTA) — Sid Caesar once dominated American television so completely that it was hard to imagine Saturday nights without him. In the early 1950s, his live sketch-comedy program “Your Show of Shows” drew tens of millions of viewers. That show and its other iterations — “The Admiral Broadway Revue,” “Caesar’s Hour” and “Sid Caesar Invites... articles.description: The estimated 0.9 percent growth rate is 'an unprecedented decline' as Israeli mortality, fertility and migration have changed significantly in recent years, according to a paper by an Israeli think tank.
